storyInfo: Loughshinny and Brigid search for Theo the apprentice, when they notice something suspicious about the city's grain shop owner. As night falls, Dublinn's victory celebration is about to begin… In the tavern, after another round of drinks, the greedy red dragon of the story makes its return.

attributes.content: I've checked every inhabited street, and found no sign of Theo anywhere. All I saw were the flames on the townsfolk growing even stronger, as if a sudden gale had swept through.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What's more, everyone just seems used to it at this point. Getting rid of the flames would only terrify them. They'd only have numbness in their body.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Does this mean it's too late for the people of Na Saoirsí?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...No. I can't think that way. My first priority is to find Theo. I should go find that nomad named Brigid, the one Nemos mentioned.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: But... would anyone really be willing to pitch a tent outside the city, just because they can't get into the Dark Woods?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: 'Walk out along the right side of the guard outpost, then wade through the creek'...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Ah. I think this is it.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: A Perro with blonde hair. Tall, yet agile.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: This must be the Brigid Nemos mentioned—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You know me?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: No, I don't believe we've met before. Nemos asked me to come find you. My name is Reed.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Brigid leans in slightly and twitches her nose twice but does not otherwise react. Loughshinny takes this to be the way the nomads greet each other.
You're not the red dragon from the city.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: What? I'm not a red dragon at all, I'm just—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You're not the one from the city—you're a different one. A second dragon returning to the city... just like the old stories.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: And you can tell with single sniff?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Sure can. Your flames smell different.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: But that's none of my business. What can I do for you, Reed?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Theo's gone missing. Nemos told me you might have an idea where he is. I've heard you often chat with him when you're in town.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: He's missing?!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: He went out this morning and never came home, and the city's in chaos today. We searched all over Na Saoirsí, both Nemos and I, but there was no sign of him anywhere.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: But I saw him just before I left the city! He was doing fine—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: No, I can't say he was 'fine'...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Anyhow, I went to the citadel after that, then left town. Haven't seen him since.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Where the heck could he be?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Theo! Theo!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Should've knocked him out and carried him back with me when I had the chance.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Say something, Theo! This time you're coming with me, you hear?!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Um, where are we, Brigid?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: This plate was dragged out during the war, supposedly to appease some noble or other. But when they brought it back, it was left like this, barely clinging on to Na Saoirsí. And no one's bothered fixing it up.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Theo always hides out here when he's feeling wronged.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Could he have left the city?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...I've only seen one person leaving the gates—Emma from Lagran Street. Theo sure wasn't with her.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: What's more, she was taking a cartful of who-knows-what to the entrance of the forest, all by her lonesome. She met up with someone there, they took the goods, then she came back by herself.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: And she didn't notice you?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The cityfolk don't see too well. Or hear. Or smell. Besides, I was pretty far from her.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: So she delivered a large shipment and returned by herself... Where did all those goods come from?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What does this Emma do for a living?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Runs a grain shop. I've delivered letters to her before.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: So a shopkeeper... left the city... and now keep close at home...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Seeing how this is the only lead we have, we should hurry over to Lagran Street.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Brigid? Reed?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Hello. You wouldn't happen to have seen Theo around, would you?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Theo? Did Nemos send you to find him?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Nope, haven't seen him. Heavens knows where that boy has run off to. I hope he didn't skip town along with the spies that set the ag plate on fire.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: How can you—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Brigid. We need to find him.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: How about Emma, then? Have you seen her anywhere?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: She closed up shop early today. Actually, I came to see if she might be willing to reopen for me, but... I guess I wasted the trip.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: *Sighs* There it is again, that cold burnt smell. It's been everywhere in Na Saoirsí lately.... I can't stand it.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I've been meaning to ask: are you able to smell purple flames?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Yeah. The scorched stench of the red dragon's flames. Lately, even the cityfolk have been reeking of it.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: It's not just the smell... The fire itself has spread to them.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What? How? I don't see any flames on 'em.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: So you can't see them either?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I was gonna ask the same thing. You saying you can see the flames?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Then again... *Sighs* Makes sense. You being a dragon too, and all.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The cityfolk live so close to the other one, even worship her like a god—guess it was only a matter of time before they got burned.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Emma, it's me. Brigid.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Emma!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Is she not in?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: With that purple flame stench comin' out of the keyhole? Must be someone in there. So what now? Break in?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...I don't see any other options.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Whoa, so dragon-fire can burn through locks, too?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...Let's save that conversation for later. We need to get in there.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Here, Officer, have a drink. We may not have a proper feast, but there's more than enough booze to go around.
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: Cheers.
attributes.name: 'The Cruel Officer'

attributes.content: Oh, if it isn't our resident Wakewoman. The Leader invited you too?
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: I'm here... to present the sacred instruments to the red dragon on behalf of the wakemen.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Ooh, offerings from the wakemen? Let's see what you've got... a whistle? And what else?
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: Samhain is almost upon us. The wakemen do not have much left to offer. This is all they could spare.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: That's it?
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: My sincerest apologies.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Weren't you the one swearing to us you'd bring in those ritual doodads to give this celebration the dignity it deserves?
attributes.name: 'The Cruel Officer'

attributes.content: I'm sorry, I didn't think it through...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Who cares? It wasn't Nemos's idea, anyway.
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: I was against it from the start. What's so auspicious about offerings from people who deal with ghosts and corpses all day? We should be glad they only gave us a whistle.
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Of course you'd take her side—she saved your life. But we can't just laugh this off! Tell us, Wakewoman, how do you plan to take responsibility for this?
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: Quiet!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: This was not solely her responsibility. If you truly wish to hold the wakemen accountable for disrespecting The Leader, we can revisit the matter later.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Set aside the matter of the ritual objects for now. The Leader sent me ahead to make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: These are difficult times, so we're keeping things simple—there will be no feast for the ceremony. But feel free to go and relax until she arrives.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Not you, Wakewoman. I expect you to provide Her Highness an explanation for your failure.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Perhaps you could take this chance to curry favor with the other officials. They could put in a good word for you later.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: I'll... pass on that, thank you.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Quite the righteous one, I see.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Brigadier, sir, these fellows, have they always been like this?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Ha. Always?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: The Bureaucrat once exhausted himself managing logistics for the Silverrock Bluffs front. He went days without sleep, until he was so worn out that he nearly collapsed on the Na Saoirsí agricultural plate.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: The Cruel Officer is a cold-hearted scoundrel, to be sure. But during the war, the wealthy merchants and nobles hoarding grain near Na Saoirsí would tremble at the mere mention of his name.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: The Torturer I've seen take pleasure in others wailing and screaming. But I've also seen him charge into the enemy ranks like a rabid tuskbeast.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Now, though? Had Her Highness not vetoed it, they'd probably be enjoying a lavish banquet right now, even with the city as it is.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: *Sighs* Will our dear Brigadier ever remove that stick from his arse?
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: You look like you're in a bit of a mood too, Bureaucrat. What's wrong?
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: What's wrong is that the city's almost out of grain, and I'm responsible.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Well, what can you do? It was a poor harvest.
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Besides, didn't I tell you to pin it on the Victorians? That Emma girl said exactly what you told her to, and the townsfolk took the bait, so what's the problem?
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Even if there is a famine, these people treat The Leader like a god. They'd never turn on us, never.
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Or are you afraid Emma will spill the beans?
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: (*whispers*) No. She's been on edge since she got back, but she follows instructions to the letter. I'm not worried about that.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: (*whispers*) What worries me is the merchant who met with her—there's been no word from him. Normally, we'd have heard something by this morning.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: (*whispers*) So there's a little delay, what's the big deal?
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: What are you two muttering about over there?
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: Oh, uh...
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: We were discussing that hero, Culann.
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: Oh? What about him?
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: At the time, he told us he took out a whole squad of Victorian scouts in the Dark Woods by himself. Four or five men, by using the terrain to his advantage. Said there was one child left behind, but he couldn't bring himself to finish the job. Sound about right?
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: But think about it. Why would a scout squad bring a child with them?
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: Huh? The Wakewoman already explained that. The scouts had taken hostages—a group of merchants who'd travel between Tara and Victoria—and forced them to guide them through the forest.
attributes.name: 'The Torturer'

attributes.content: Sure, I buy that there was a caravan, but the scouts? *sighs* I don't know about that...
attributes.name: 'The Ombudsman'

attributes.content: 'but the scouts? I don't know about that...'
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: His throat getting dry, the writer grabs his mug, only to find it devoid of beer.
I'll go get you some more.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: The mysterious woman stands up and heads to the bar. The writer leans back in his chair.
As has been his habit for many years, he sets about planning how to make the next part of his story captivating. However, as he thinks it through, a sudden tightness grips his heart.
Even if this woman is also a survivor, and even if she knows a thing or two about what happened, he cannot simply lay everything out there like he has been, at least not for this next part.
Heavens knows what she would have to say about it.
This is just a story. A shadow cast on the wall, not the fire itself. A storyteller must always remember this, or they will find themselves consumed by the flames.
Here you are, your beer.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Thank you kindly. Now where were we?
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: The Dublinner's ugliness at the celebration banquet.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Oh, right.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Well then. The true star of the party is about to make her entrance...
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: The true star of the party is about to make her entrance.
But until then, Dublinn's ugly visage will remain, so hideous that no one can face it directly.
*sighs* Well, I—
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Tch.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: 'The Cruel Officer'

attributes.content: Is there something crawling on my head?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Ha. It may be freezing here in Na Saoirsí, but at least there are still bugs. Don't move. I'll grab it.
attributes.name: 'The Cruel Officer'

attributes.content: W-Wait...
attributes.name: 'The Cruel Officer'

attributes.content: The banquet hall suddenly quiets down.
Everyone is staring at The Bureaucrat's head, where a beetle is perched.
A solid gold beetle.
...Uh, one of the decorations fell down. Go on, put it back.
attributes.name: 'The Cruel Officer'

attributes.content: The Officer removes the gold beetle from The Bureaucrat's head and places it in his palm.

The Bureaucrat lets out a sigh of relief. He is about to place the beetle back in its original spot when it flutters its diamond-encrusted wings, flies a short distance towards the door, and lands in the center of the hall.
He takes a few steps forward, and the beetle, as if tempting him, crawls a little further ahead.
Such enthusiasm, Mr. Bureaucrat!
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Your Highness?!
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: I-I just wanted to catch this stray beetle for you!
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Of course. Why would I blame you for that?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: O-Oh, alright then.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: By the way, about the sacred instruments I reported to you about...
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: A trifling matter.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: What is truly important is that my faithful servants be rewarded for this victory.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Eblana picks up the beetle from the ground and flattens her palm. The beetle buzzes as it flies toward the door.
Ladies and gentlemen, we are in the very hall where the treasures of the ancient King Gaeil were once displayed.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The furnishings had all been looted by the Victorians, as they are wont to do, but we have finally returned most of them to their rightful places.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: That beetle you were chasing was awarded personally to a capable official. He was praised for his tireless work in gathering ever last grain of the harvest and storing it in the treasury.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And now, you are worthy of the same. Without you, our army would likely have collapsed from hunger a hundred times over.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Go chase it down, for it is yours. As long as it is willing to land on you, you will always have the right to collect our grain.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Yes... Thank you!
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Now then...
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Eblana scans the room.
Some stare intently at The Bureaucrat's back, wondering what rewards they will receive, while others cannot help but glance at the other treasures in the room.
The sword that enforces the law, the cloudbeast that listens to appeals, the knot that records history, the crystal teardrops that symbolize compassion...
It seems none of you can stand to wait any longer.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: How about this, then: everyone, feel free to take whatever in this room you desire.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: In an instant, it is as if all the treasures come to life, moving on their own.

The cloudbeast statue starts running, the crystals start rolling, the knot begins to twist, and even the ceremonial sword studded with Sargonian jewels breaks free from its stand, hopping comically toward the door.
Go, my servants. These are my rewards for your loyalty.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: It is unclear who takes the first step, but once he does, the tide is unstoppable.
The crowd chases after the treasures, surging out of the banquet hall.
